data.name: Greatest Determinant of Submatrices
data.description:
# Background knowledge
[Determinant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Determinant) of a square matrix is a number. We can calculate the determinant by the following properties.
```
For all 1*1 matrix
[[a]],
the determinant is a.

For all 2*2 matrix
[[a, b],
 [c, d]],
the determinant is ad - bc.

For all 3*3 matrix
[[a, b, c],
 [d, e, f],
 [g, h, i]],
the determinant is a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg).

Note that the determinant of 3*3 matrix can also be:

a*det(a_minor) - b*det(b_minor) + c*det(c_minor),

where a_minor is equal to
[[e, f],
 [h, i]],
b_minor is equal to
[[d, f],
 [g, i]] and
c_minor is equal to
[[d, e],
 [g, h]].

Therefore, the determinant of 4*4 matrix is
a*det(a_minor) - b*det(b_minor) + c*det(c_minor) - d*det(d_minor) and so on.
```
# Remark
The non-square matrix does not have a determinant.

It is recommended to finish [this kata](https://www.codewars.com/kata/52a382ee44408cea2500074c) first. 


# Definition of submatrix
A `$p×q$` submatrix of an `$m×n$` matrix (with `$p\le m$`, `$q\le n$`) is a `$p×q$` matrix formed by taking a block of the entries of this size from the original matrix.

# Example 1
```
[[1, 2],
 [3, 4]]
is a submatrix of
[[1, 2, 3],
 [4, 5, 6],
 [7, 8, 9]].

Similarly, 
[[5]]
is a submatrix of
[[5, 4, 3],
 [2, 1, 0]].
```

# Task
Given an `m*n` matrix `M`, calculate the determinant of all submatrices and return the greatest determinant of them.

# Example 2
```
For M = [[2, -3, 1],
         [1, 0, -2]],
gdet(M) -> 6.
Which is the determinant of submatrix
[[-3, 1],
 [0, -2]].


For M = [[5, -3, 0, 1],
         [1, 2, -1, 2],
         [9, 1, 2, -6],
         [6, 7, -1, 1]],
gdet(M) -> 58.
Which is the determinant of submatrix
[[5, -3, 0],
 [1, 2, -1],
 [9, 1, 2]].
```
# Input/Output
- `1` <= `m, n` <= `15`.
- `-50` < elements of matrix < `50`.
- The type of elements of matrix are `int`.
- All input are valid.
- The type of output should be `int`.

There are 80 random tests. Good luck and happy coding!
